Opportunity.name: Opportunity
Opportunity.description: The set of circumstances that makes it appropriate to develop or change a software system

Identified.name: Identified
Identified.description: A commercial, social, or business opportunity has been identified that could be addressed by a software-based solution

An idea for a way of improving current w.name: An idea for a way of improving current ways of working, increasing market share, or applying a new or innovative software system has been identified

At least one of the stakeholders wishes.name: At least one of the stakeholders wishes to make an investment in better understanding the opportunity and the value associated with addressing it

The other stakeholders who share the opp.name: The other stakeholders who share the opportunity have been identified

SolutionNeeded.name: Solution Needed
SolutionNeeded.description: The need for a software-based solution has been confirmed

The stakeholders in the opportunity and.name: The stakeholders in the opportunity and the proposed solution have been identified

The stakeholders' needs that generate th.name: The stakeholders' needs that generate the opportunity have been established

Any underlying problems and their root c.name: Any underlying problems and their root causes have been identified

It has been confirmed that a software-ba.name: It has been confirmed that a software-based solution is needed

At least one software-based solution has.name: At least one software-based solution has been proposed

ValueEstablished.name: Value Established
ValueEstablished.description: The value of a successful solution has been established

The value of addressing the opportunity.name: The value of addressing the opportunity has been quantified either in absolute terms or in returns or savings per time period

The impact of the solution on the stakeh.name: The impact of the solution on the stakeholders is understood

The value that the software system offer.name: The value that the software system offers to the stakeholders that fund and use the software system is understood

The success criteria by which the deploy.name: The success criteria by which the deployment of the software system is to be judged are clear

The desired outcomes required of the sol.name: The desired outcomes required of the solution are clear and quantified

Viable.name: Viable
Viable.description: It is agreed that a solution can be produced quickly and cheaply enough to successfully address the opportunity

The indications are that the solution ca.name: The indications are that the solution can be developed and deployed within constraints

The risks associated with the solution a.name: The risks associated with the solution are acceptable and manageable

The indicative (ball-park) costs of the.name: The indicative (ball-park) costs of the solution are less than the anticipated value of the opportunity

The reasons for the development of a sof.name: The reasons for the development of a software-based solution are understood by all members of the team

It is clear that the pursuit of the oppo.name: It is clear that the pursuit of the opportunity is viable

Addressed.name: Addressed
Addressed.description: A solution has been produced that demonstrably addresses the opportunity

A usable system that demonstrably addres.name: A usable system that demonstrably addresses the opportunity is available

The stakeholders agree that the availabl.name: The stakeholders agree that the available solution is worth deploying

The stakeholders are satisfied that the.name: The stakeholders are satisfied that the solution produced addresses the opportunity

BenefitAccrued.name: Benefit Accrued
BenefitAccrued.description: The operational use or sale of the solution is creating tangible benefits

The solution has started to accrue benef.name: The solution has started to accrue benefits for the stakeholders

The return-on-investment profile is at l.name: The return-on-investment profile is at least as good as anticipated

Stakeholders.name: Stakeholders
Stakeholders.description: The people, groups, or organizations who affect or are affected by a software system

All the different groups of stakeholders.name: All the different groups of stakeholders that are, or will be, affected by the development and operation of the software system are identified

There is agreement on the stakeholder gr.name: There is agreement on the stakeholder groups to be represented, At a minimum, the stakeholders groups that fund, use, support, and maintain the system have been considered

The responsibilities of the stakeholder.name: The responsibilities of the stakeholder representatives have been defined

Represented.name: Represented
Represented.description: The mechanisms for involving the stakeholders are agreed and the stakeholder representatives have been appointed

The stakeholder representatives have agr.name: The stakeholder representatives have agreed to take on their responsibilities

The stakeholder representatives are auth.name: The stakeholder representatives are authorized to carry out their responsibilities

The collaboration approach among the sta.name: The collaboration approach among the stakeholder representatives has been agreed

The stakeholder representatives support.name: The stakeholder representatives support and respect the team's way of working

Involved.name: Involved
Involved.description: The stakeholder representatives are actively involved in the work and fulfilling their responsibilities

The stakeholder representatives assist t.name: The stakeholder representatives assist the team in accordance with their responsibilities

The stakeholder representatives provide.name: The stakeholder representatives provide feedback and take part in decision making in a timely manner

The stakeholder representatives promptly.name: The stakeholder representatives promptly communicate changes that are relevant for their stakeholder groups

InAgreement.name: In Agreement
InAgreement.description: The stakeholder representatives are in agreement

The stakeholder representatives have agr.name: The stakeholder representatives have agreed upon their minimal expectations for the next deployment of the new system

The stakeholder representatives are happ.name: The stakeholder representatives are happy with their involvement in the work

The stakeholder representatives agree th.name: The stakeholder representatives agree that their input is valued by the team and treated with respect

The team members agree that their input.name: The team members agree that their input is valued by the stakeholder representatives and treated with respect

The stakeholder representatives agree wi.name: The stakeholder representatives agree with how their different priorities and perspectives are being balanced to provide a clear direction for the team

SatisfiedforDeployment.name: Satisfied for Deployment
SatisfiedforDeployment.description: The minimal expectations of the stakeholder representatives have been achieved

The stakeholder representatives provide.name: The stakeholder representatives provide feedback on the system from their stakeholder group perspective

The stakeholder representatives confirm.name: The stakeholder representatives confirm that they agree that the system is ready for deployment

SatisfiedinUse.name: Satisfied in Use
SatisfiedinUse.description: The system has met or exceeds the minimal stakeholder expectations

Stakeholders are using the new system an.name: Stakeholders are using the new system and providing feedback on their experiences

The stakeholders confirm that the new sy.name: The stakeholders confirm that the new system meets their expectations

Requirements.name: Requirements
Requirements.description: What the software system must do to address the opportunity and satisfy the stakeholders

Conceived.name: Conceived
Conceived.description: The need for a new system has been agreed

The initial set of stakeholders agrees t.name: The initial set of stakeholders agrees that a system is to be produced

The stakeholders that will use the new s.name: The stakeholders that will use the new system are identified

The stakeholders that will fund the init.name: The stakeholders that will fund the initial work on the new system are identified

There is a clear opportunity for the new.name: There is a clear opportunity for the new system to address

Bounded.name: Bounded
Bounded.description: The purpose and extent of the new system are clear

The stakeholders involved in developing.name: The stakeholders involved in developing the new system are identified

The stakeholders agree on the purpose of.name: The stakeholders agree on the purpose of the new system

It is clear what success is for the new.name: It is clear what success is for the new system

The stakeholders have a shared understan.name: The stakeholders have a shared understanding of the extent of the proposed solution

The way the requirements will be describ.name: The way the requirements will be described is agreed upon

The mechanisms for managing the requirem.name: The mechanisms for managing the requirements are in place

Coherent.name: Coherent
Coherent.description: The requirements provide a consistent description of the essential characteristics of the new system

The requirements are captured and shared.name: The requirements are captured and shared with the team and the stakeholders

The origin of the requirements is clear.name: The origin of the requirements is clear

The rationale behind the requirements is.name: The rationale behind the requirements is clear

Conflicting requirements are identified.name: Conflicting requirements are identified and attended to

The requirements communicate the essenti.name: The requirements communicate the essential characteristics of the system to be delivered

The most important usage scenarios for t.name: The most important usage scenarios for the system can be explained

The priority of the requirements is clea.name: The priority of the requirements is clear

The impact of implementing the requireme.name: The impact of implementing the requirements is understood

The team understands what has to be deli.name: The team understands what has to be delivered and agrees to deliver it

Acceptable.name: Acceptable
Acceptable.description: The requirements describe a system that is acceptable to the stakeholders

The stakeholders accept that the require.name: The stakeholders accept that the requirements describe an acceptable solution

The rate of change to the agreed require.name: The rate of change to the agreed requirements is relatively low and under control

The value provided by implementing the r.name: The value provided by implementing the requirements is clear

The parts of the opportunity satisfied b.name: The parts of the opportunity satisfied by the requirements are clear

Addressed.name: Addressed
Addressed.description: Enough of the requirements have been addressed to satisfy the need for a new system in a way that is acceptable to the stakeholders

Enough of the requirements are addressed.name: Enough of the requirements are addressed for the resulting system to be acceptable to the stakeholders

The stakeholders accept the requirements.name: The stakeholders accept the requirements as accurately reflecting what the system does and does not do

The set of requirement items implemented.name: The set of requirement items implemented provide clear value to the stakeholders

The system implementing the requirements.name: The system implementing the requirements is accepted by the stakeholders as worth making operational

Fulfilled.name: Fulfilled
Fulfilled.description: The requirements that have been addressed fully satisfy the need for a new system

The stakeholders accept the requirements.name: The stakeholders accept the requirements as accurately capturing what they require to fully satisfy the need for a new system

There are no outstanding requirement ite.name: There are no outstanding requirement items preventing the system from being accepted as fully satisfying the requirements

The system is accepted by the stakeholde.name: The system is accepted by the stakeholders as fully satisfying the requirements

SoftwareSystem.name: Software System
SoftwareSystem.description: A system made up of software, hardware, and data that provides its primary value by the execution of the software

ArchitectureSelected.name: Architecture Selected
ArchitectureSelected.description: An architecture has been selected that addresses the key technical risks and any applicable organizational constraints

The criteria to be used when selecting t.name: The criteria to be used when selecting the architecture have been agreed on

Programming languages and technologies t.name: Programming languages and technologies to be used have been selected

Significant decisions about the organiza.name: Significant decisions about the organization of the system have been made

Buy, build, and reuse decisions have bee.name: Buy, build, and reuse decisions have been made

Demonstrable.name: Demonstrable
Demonstrable.description: An executable version of the system is available that demonstrates the architecture is fit for purpose and supports testing

Key architectural characteristics have b.name: Key architectural characteristics have been demonstrated

The system can be exercised and its perf.name: The system can be exercised and its performance can be measured

Critical hardware configurations have be.name: Critical hardware configurations have been demonstrated

The integration with other existing syst.name: The integration with other existing systems has been demonstrated

The relevant stakeholders agree that the.name: The relevant stakeholders agree that the demonstrated architecture is appropriate

Usable.name: Usable
Usable.description: The system is usable and demonstrates all of the quality characteristics of an operational system

The system can be operated by stakeholde.name: The system can be operated by stakeholders who use it

The functionality provided by the system.name: The functionality provided by the system has been tested

The performance of the system is accepta.name: The performance of the system is acceptable to the stakeholders

Defect levels are acceptable to the stak.name: Defect levels are acceptable to the stakeholders

The added value provided by the system i.name: The added value provided by the system is clear

Ready.name: Ready
Ready.description: The system (as a whole) has been accepted for deployment in a live environment

Installation and other user documentatio.name: Installation and other user documentation are available

The stakeholder representatives accept t.name: The stakeholder representatives accept the system as fit-for-purpose

The stakeholder representatives want to.name: The stakeholder representatives want to make the system operational

Operational.name: Operational
Operational.description: The system is in use in an operational environment

The system has been made available to th.name: The system has been made available to the stakeholders intended to use it

At least one example of the system is fu.name: At least one example of the system is fully operational

The system is fully supported to the agr.name: The system is fully supported to the agreed service levels

Retired.name: Retired
Retired.description: The system is no longer supported

The system has been replaced or disconti.name: The system has been replaced or discontinued

The system is no longer supported.name: The system is no longer supported

There are no “official” stakeholders who.name: There are no “official” stakeholders who still use the system

Updates to the system will no longer be.name: Updates to the system will no longer be produced

Work.name: Work
Work.description: Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a result

The result required of the work being in.name: The result required of the work being initiated is clear

Any constraints on the work’s performanc.name: Any constraints on the work’s performance are clearly identified

The stakeholders that will fund the work.name: The stakeholders that will fund the work are known

The initiator of the work is clearly ide.name: The initiator of the work is clearly identified

The stakeholders that will accept the re.name: The stakeholders that will accept the results are known

The source of funding is clear.name: The source of funding is clear

The priority of the work is clear.name: The priority of the work is clear

Prepared.name: Prepared
Prepared.description: All pre-conditions for starting the work have been met

Cost and effort of the work are estimate.name: Cost and effort of the work are estimated

Governance policies and procedures are c.name: Governance policies and procedures are clear

Acceptance criteria are defined and agre.name: Acceptance criteria are defined and agreed with client

The work is broken down sufficiently for.name: The work is broken down sufficiently for productive work to start

Tasks have been identified and prioritiz.name: Tasks have been identified and prioritized by the team and stakeholders

A credible plan is in place.name: A credible plan is in place

Funding to start the work is in place.name: Funding to start the work is in place

The team or at least some of the team me.name: The team or at least some of the team members are ready to start the work

Integration and delivery points are defi.name: Integration and delivery points are defined

The work is being broken down into actio.name: The work is being broken down into actionable work items with clear definitions of done

Team members are accepting and progressi.name: Team members are accepting and progressing tasks

UnderControl.name: Under Control
UnderControl.description: The work is going well, risks are under control, and productivity levels are sufficient to achieve a satisfactory result

Risks are under control as the impact if.name: Risks are under control as the impact if they occur and the likelihood of them occurring have been reduced to acceptable levels

Estimates are revised to reflect the tea.name: Estimates are revised to reflect the team’s performance

Measures are available to show progress.name: Measures are available to show progress and velocity

Tasks are consistently completed on time.name: Tasks are consistently completed on time and within their estimates

Concluded.name: Concluded
Concluded.description: The work to produce the results has been concluded

All outstanding tasks are administrative.name: All outstanding tasks are administrative housekeeping or related to preparing the next piece of work

The stakeholder(s) has accepted the resu.name: The stakeholder(s) has accepted the resulting software system

Closed.name: Closed
Closed.description: All remaining housekeeping tasks have been completed and the work has been officially closed

Lessons learned have been itemized, reco.name: Lessons learned have been itemized, recorded and discussed

The budget has been reconciled and close.name: The budget has been reconciled and closed

There are no outstanding, uncompleted ta.name: There are no outstanding, uncompleted tasks

Choose the members of the team.name: Choose the members of the team

Team.name: Team
Team.description: A group of people actively engaged in the development, maintenance, delivery, or support of a specific software system

Seeded.name: Seeded
Seeded.description: The team’s mission is clear and the know-how needed to grow the team is in place

The team mission has been defined in ter.name: The team mission has been defined in terms of the opportunities and outcomes

Constraints on the team's operation are.name: Constraints on the team's operation are known

Mechanisms to grow the team are in place.name: Mechanisms to grow the team are in place

The composition of the team is defined.name: The composition of the team is defined

Any constraints on where and how the wor.name: Any constraints on where and how the work is carried out are defined

The level of team commitment is clear.name: The level of team commitment is clear

Formed.name: Formed
Formed.description: The team has been populated with enough committed people to start the mission

Enough team members have been recruited.name: Enough team members have been recruited to enable the work to progress

Every team member understands how the te.name: Every team member understands how the team is organized and what their individual role is

All team members understand how to perfo.name: All team members understand how to perform their work

The team members have met (perhaps virtu.name: The team members have met (perhaps virtually) and are beginning to get to know each other

The team members understand their respon.name: The team members understand their responsibilities and how they align with their competencies

Any external collaborators (organization.name: Any external collaborators (organizations, teams and individuals) are identified

Team communication mechanisms have been.name: Team communication mechanisms have been defined

Each team member commits to working on t.name: Each team member commits to working on the team as defined

Collaborating.name: Collaborating
Collaborating.description: The team members are working together as one unit

The team is working as one cohesive unit.name: The team is working as one cohesive unit

Communication within the team is open an.name: Communication within the team is open and honest

The team is focused on achieving the tea.name: The team is focused on achieving the team mission

The team members know each other.name: The team members know each other

Performing.name: Performing
Performing.description: The team is working effectively and efficiently

The team consistently meets its commitme.name: The team consistently meets its commitments

The team continuously adapts to the chan.name: The team continuously adapts to the changing context

The team identifies and addresses proble.name: The team identifies and addresses problems without outside help

Effective progress is being achieved wit.name: Effective progress is being achieved with minimal avoidable backtracking and reworking

Wasted work, and the potential for waste.name: Wasted work, and the potential for wasted work are continuously eliminated

Adjourned.name: Adjourned
Adjourned.description: The team is no longer accountable for carrying out its mission

The team responsibilities have been hand.name: The team responsibilities have been handed over or fulfilled

The team members are available for assig.name: The team members are available for assignment to other teams

No further effort is being put in by the.name: No further effort is being put in by the team to complete the mission

WayofWorking.name: Way-of-Working
WayofWorking.description: The tailored set of practices and tools used by a team to guide and support their work

PrinciplesEstablished.name: Principles Established
PrinciplesEstablished.description: The principles, and constraints, that shape the way-of-working are established

Principles and constraints are committed.name: Principles and constraints are committed to by the team

Principles and constraints are agreed to.name: Principles and constraints are agreed to by the stakeholders

The tool needs of the work and its stake.name: The tool needs of the work and its stakeholders are agreed

A recommendation for the approach to be.name: A recommendation for the approach to be taken is available

The context within which the team will o.name: The context within which the team will operate is understood

The constraints that apply to the select.name: The constraints that apply to the selection, acquisition, and use of practices and tools are known

FoundationEstablished.name: Foundation Established
FoundationEstablished.description: The key practices, and tools, that form the foundation of the way of working are selected and ready for use

The key practices and tools that form th.name: The key practices and tools that form the foundation of the way-of-working are selected

Enough practices for work to start are a.name: Enough practices for work to start are agreed to by the team

All non-negotiable practices and tools h.name: All non-negotiable practices and tools have been identified

The gaps that exist between the practice.name: The gaps that exist between the practices and tools that are needed and the practices and tools that are available have been analyzed and understood

The capability gaps that exist between w.name: The capability gaps that exist between what is needed to execute the desired way of working and the capability levels of the team have been analyzed and understood

The selected practices and tools have be.name: The selected practices and tools have been integrated to form a usable way-of-working

InUse.name: In Use
InUse.description: Some members of the team are using, and adapting, the way-of-working

The practices and tools are being used t.name: The practices and tools are being used to do real work

The use of the practices and tools selec.name: The use of the practices and tools selected are regularly inspected

The practices and tools are being adapte.name: The practices and tools are being adapted to the team’s context

The use of the practices and tools is su.name: The use of the practices and tools is supported by the team

Procedures are in place to handle feedba.name: Procedures are in place to handle feedback on the team’s way of working

The practices and tools support team com.name: The practices and tools support team communication and collaboration

InPlace.name: In Place
InPlace.description: All team members are using the way of working to accomplish their work

The practices and tools are being used b.name: The practices and tools are being used by the whole team to perform their work

All team members have access to the prac.name: All team members have access to the practices and tools required to do their work

The whole team is involved in the inspec.name: The whole team is involved in the inspection and adaptation of the way-of-working

WorkingWell.name: Working Well
WorkingWell.description: The team's way of working is working well for the team

Team members are making progress as plan.name: Team members are making progress as planned by using and adapting the way-of-working to suit their current context

The team naturally applies the practices.name: The team naturally applies the practices without thinking about them

The tools naturally support the way that.name: The tools naturally support the way that the team works

The team continually tunes their use of.name: The team continually tunes their use of the practices and tools

Retired.name: Retired
Retired.description: The way of working is no longer in use by the team

The team's way of working is no longer b.name: The team's way of working is no longer being used

Lessons learned are shared for future us.name: Lessons learned are shared for future use

ExplorePossibilities.name: Explore Possibilities
ExplorePossibilities.description: Explore the possibilities presented by the creation of a new or improved software system. This includes the analysis of the opportunity to be addressed and the identification of the stakeholders

UnderstandStakeholderNeeds.name: Understand Stakeholder Needs
UnderstandStakeholderNeeds.description: Engage with the stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure that the right results are produced. This includes identifying and working with the stakeholder representatives to progress the opportunity

EnsureStakeholderSatisfaction.name: Ensure Stakeholder Satisfaction
EnsureStakeholderSatisfaction.description: Share the results of the development work with the stakeholders to gain their acceptance of the system produced and verify that the opportunity has been successfully addressed

UsetheSystem.name: Use the System
UsetheSystem.description: Observe the use of the system in a live environment and how it benefits the stakeholders

UnderstandtheRequirements.name: Understand the Requirements
UnderstandtheRequirements.description: Establish a shared understanding of what the system to be produced must do

ShapetheSystem.name: Shape the System
ShapetheSystem.description: Shape the system so that it is easy to develop, change and maintain, and can cope with current and expected future demands. This includes the overall design and architecting of the system to be produced

ImplementtheSystem.name: Implement the System
ImplementtheSystem.description: Build a system by implementing, testing, and integrating one or more system elements. This includes bug fixing and unit testing

TesttheSystem.name: Test the System
TesttheSystem.description: Verify that the system produced meets the stakeholders’ requirements

DeploytheSystem.name: Deploy the System
DeploytheSystem.description: Take the tested system and make it available for use outside the development team

OperatetheSystem.name: Operate the System
OperatetheSystem.description: Support the use of the software system in the live environment

PreparetodotheWork.name: Prepare to do the Work
PreparetodotheWork.description: Set up the team and its working environment. Understand and commit to completing the work

Sprint Planning Meeting.name: Sprint Planning Meeting
Sprint Planning Meeting.description: A meeting to plan for a 2 week sprint lead by project manager

CoordinateActivity.name: Coordinate Activity
CoordinateActivity.description: Co-ordinate and direct the team’s work. This includes all on-going planning and re-planning of the work, and re-shaping of the team

Daily Scrum.name: Daily Scrum
Daily Scrum.description: Lead by Scrum Master every day at 9.00 am

SupporttheTeam.name: Support the Team
SupporttheTeam.description: Help the team members to help themselves, collaborate and improve their way of working

Sprint Retrospective.name: Sprint Retrospective
Sprint Retrospective.description: Ask member if they have problems

TrackProgress.name: Track Progress
TrackProgress.description: Measure and assess the progress made by the team

Sprint Review.name: Sprint Review
Sprint Review.description: Review the 2 week sprint, ask the member if they have problems or not

StoptheWork.name: Stop the Work
StoptheWork.description: Shut-down the software engineering endeavor and handover of the team’s responsibilities
